Package projectmanager

Class ProjectManager

java.lang.Object
projectmanager.ProjectManager
public class ProjectManager
extends java.lang.Object
This application class is a project-management program that allows users to create, view, update, and finalize projects stored in an SQL database.

It was developed for a fictional small structural engineering firm called Poised.

Upon startup, this class reads project and person info from the DB. It passes the info to Project and Person constructors, and stores the resulting objects in four LinkedHashMaps - two reference Maps, and two operational Maps. Upon exiting, this class compares the reference and operational Maps, and writes any changes to DB. The main method follows a boolean control structure consisting of one main menu loop, three submenu loops, and one select-project loop.

Changes from V2.0: Main method shortened and refactored into static methods. Methods selectProject, generateInvoice, viewAll, viewIncomplete, and viewPastDue moved to Project. Methods selectPerson and updatePerson moved to Person.

Changes from V2.1: Class no longer creates/uses text files; SQL DB functionality added via methods readTable, writeToTable, startSequenceCreateMaps, and endSequenceMapsToTables (they replace removed startSequenceReadHashmap and endSequenceWriteToFile). .

Version:
V3.0 August 2021
Author:
J.E. Foster Â©

    • startSequenceCreateMaps

      public static void startSequenceCreateMaps​(java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Reads all information from all DB tables via readTable, then uses the info to populate reference and operational Maps with Project or Person objects via Project.populateProjectsMap and Person.populatePersonsMap.

      This method runs at program startup.

      Parameters:
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V3.0

    • select

      public static Project select​(java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Selects and returns a project via Project.selectProject

      If selected project doesn't exist, this method allows back-navigation via backToMenus1, else activates submenu loop via static boolean submenu.

      Parameters:
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      Returns:
      the selected Project
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors

    • updateSubmenuOutcomes

      public static void updateSubmenuOutcomes​(java.lang.String choiceUp, Project selectedProject, java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Controls update-submenu outcomes that update Project and Person details via Project.setDeadLine, Project.setTotalPaid, Person.updatePerson, and Project.generateInvoice.

      This method allows back-navigation via backToMenus1, backToMenus2, and directly changing static booleans.

      Parameters:
      choiceUp - a String containing an update-submenu choice
      selectedProject - a Project selected by the user
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V2.1

    • endSequenceMapsToTables

      public static void endSequenceMapsToTables​(java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Writes updated and new Project and Person attributes in operational Map to corresponding DB table via writeToTable.

      To decompose Projects and Persons stored in the Maps, this method uses Project.mapToList and Person.mapToList. This method runs upon exiting program.

      Parameters:
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V3.0

    • getProjectAndPersonInfo

      public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getProjectAndPersonInfo()
      Gets and validates new Project and Person attribute values via checkUserInput, and returns a List of Lists containing the info as Strings.

      User input is validated against regular expressions.

      Returns:
      a List of Lists containing new project and person info Strings
      Since:
      V1

      Returns:
      a List containing new Person attribute Strings
      Since:

    • checkUserInput

      public static java.lang.String checkUserInput​(java.lang.String prompt, java.lang.String regex, java.lang.String errorPrompt)
      Validates input against a regular expression, displays an error message while input doesn't match, and returns the input String once it matches.
      Parameters:
      prompt - a String prompting user input
      regex - the regular expression that user input is matched against
      errorPrompt - the error message String displayed if user input does not match regex
      Returns:
      a String containing the user input
      Since:
      V2.0

    • backToMenus1

      public static boolean backToMenus1​(java.lang.String optionString, boolean staticBoolean, java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Controls back-navigation after completion of an operation.

      This method allows for three back-navigation options: go back to a submenu or select another project, go back to the main menu, or exit, via changing and returning a static control boolean (passed as parameter).

      Refactored from V1 backtoMenus method.

      Parameters:
      optionString - a String displaying the navigation options
      staticBoolean - the relevant static control boolean
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      Returns:
      the relevant static control boolean - changed according to user navigation choice
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V2.0

    • backToMenus2

      public static void backToMenus2​(java.lang.String optionString, java.sql.Connection connection) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Controls back-navigation after completion of an operation.

      This method allows for 4 navigation options: go back to a submenu, select another project, go back to the main menu, or exit, via directly changing static control booleans.

      Refactored from V1 backtoMenus method.

      Parameters:
      optionString - a String displaying the navigation options
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V2.0

    • readTable

      public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> readTable​(java.sql.Connection connection, java.util.List<java.lang.String> columnList, java.lang.String tableName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Reads all data from a DB table and returns a List of Lists containing specified column value Strings for each row.
      Parameters:
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      columnList - a List containing table column name Strings
      tableName - a String containing the table name
      Returns:
      a List of Lists containing each table row as a separate String List
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V3.0

    • writeToTable

      public static void writeToTable​(java.sql.Connection connection, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> listExist, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> listNew, java.util.List<java.lang.String> columnList, java.lang.String tableName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Writes new and updated Project or Person information to a DB table, and displays amount of updated and inserted cells/rows in the table.

      This method compares attribute info for each Project or Person in the reference and operational Maps. If attribute values differ, new values are written to their corresponding DB rows/columns. If new Projects or Persons were added to operational Map, these are inserted as new DB rows.

      Parameters:
      connection - an SQL database Connection
      listExist - a List of Lists containing Project and Person info Stringsfrom reference Map
      listNew - a List of Lists containing Project and Person info from operational Map
      columnList - a List containing column name Strings
      tableName - a List containing the table name Strings
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - provides information on a database access errors or other SQL related errors
      Since:
      V3.0
